page.title: 05Local History of Hannington
page.content: Hannington has its place in history, it was claimed as the birthplace of the famous Archbishop Warham in the time of Henry VII & VIII. Part of All Saints church dates back to before the Norman conquest & is mentioned in the Domesday book. A 100 year old C of E Aided school for approximately 40 children existed until 1984 when it was closed and is now awaiting plan_ ning permission for conversion to housing. We also have a small Methodist Chapel built in 1871. There are five remaining thatched cottages, one of which is named Tyn_y_ Bryn, recently authenticated as 14th century origin, and is now a listed building. It stands opposite the green which was once the village pond!
